An absent-minded admin leaked half his RSA private key digits in a forum post. Can you recover his message? Ciphertext: 4136512390020091595661483452621532049226068705103333197366555298841181886747678390799032855155783900709246809311303388937608989120567728387332207881687059

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5152451252230750907653753980384381854341300675133194659039378028311835596578718312388134838113652093011679196920789454842463321090691158523534407619685613, e=3505484217608643921600954335175466728290585327247820326694674099502068961714667143622508994563251615053114666841891837471032305369929949086331270489685091, partial_p=10102210824433388660

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{upezy7fn}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 4136512390020091595661483452621532049226068705103333197366555298841181886747678390799032855155783900709246809311303388937608989120567728387332207881687059
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5152451252230750907653753980384381854341300675133194659039378028311835596578718312388134838113652093011679196920789454842463321090691158523534407619685613, e=3505484217608643921600954335175466728290585327247820326694674099502068961714667143622508994563251615053114666841891837471032305369929949086331270489685091, partial_p=10102210824433388660
extra_info: p=63412605097292934950447593589467355997464738059553452403975228853230447293987, q=81252792632086763184668553168473791965647529329093067909176751304054442170799, Ï†(n)=5152451252230750907653753980384381854341300675133194659039378028311835596578573646990405458415516976864921255772826342575074674570378006543377122730220828
